sub_title: Freelance Landscape Photographer | Programme Coordinator  | International Relations | Study Abroad | Programme & Education Development | Budget management
summary:
My passion for study abroad started by more than 10 years ago when going abroad to Mongolia. Nowadays, I really enjoy seeing how students grow and develop them selves when being abroad.

All started with following my dream, backpacking in Australia and New Zealand when I was 20 years old. After seeing four different continents and being back in the Netherlands, with a backpack full of new experiences, I decided to start a study in which my hobbies of travelling and events where combined. In 2007, I successfully completed the Bachelor Tourism & Event management which focussed on different aspects of tourism and events
Ever since I truly enjoy working in an international environment and learning from other cultures to make use of other best practices. The best learning experiences are still studying abroad in Mongolia and living abroad in Madrid as it made me grow in many different ways, but it also make it easier for me to understand people from abroad when they come to the Netherlands to either study or work.


Specialties: Programme Coordination - Event Support - Contract Negotiation – Flexible -  Accurate - Positive mentality - Open minded 

Kim Willems
TEL: +31-650524619

education.field_of_study: Teaching English as a Second or Foreign Language/ESL Language Instructor

awards.title: Service Excellence Award of Maastricht University - School for Business and Economics
awards.description: Winner of the annual Service Excellence award with the IRO Outgoing team for our flexibility and additional work in order to re-allocated students in a short time frame as partner universities had to cancel their exchanges due to political situations in the countries they are based in.
awards.issuer: Maastricht University - School for Business and Economics

projects.title: TEFAF City branding pilot
projects.description:
Involved in creating a new policy for city promotion and marketing by using the city and existing events. The pilot was about city dressing to make visitors feel welcome while attending an event.
The pilot event was the world largest art fair TEFAF. On several locations in the city, the regional airport and the train station of Liege Guillemins we put banners and flags referring to the art fair. 
This pilot lead afterwards to a new policy which is now in use with the municipality for city dressing and making visitors feel welcome while attending an event.

projects.title: International Society for the Study of Fatty Acids and Lipids (ISSFAL) 2010
projects.description:
International conference with 800 participants.

As Conference manager responsible for the logistics arrangements of the conference. The logistics included venue finding, hotel reservations for participants and speakers, catering, event supplies, publications.
Staying in contact with local organizing committee, participants, sponsors and suppliers.
Being in charge of setting up a partner programme and social programme such as city tour, gala dinner and boat tour.

Being involved in budgetting the whole conference.

projects.title: Benelux Bioinformatics Conference 2008
projects.description:
The Benelux Bioinformatics Conference was a two-day international conference on bioinformatics. Computational methods and mathematical models are playing an ever increasing role in large-scale "omics" molecular biology, leading to the emergence of bioinformatics as a scientific discipline within Systems Biology, with major applications in health and green biotechnology. The Benelux Bioinformatics Conference is the primary community event for bioinformatics researchers in the Netherlands, Belgium, and Luxemburg with excellent networking opportunities. The conference is aimed at both academic and industry researchers. 

As Conference manager responsible for the logistics arrangements of the conference. The logistics included venue finding, hotel reservations for participants and speakers, catering, event supplies, publications.
Staying in contact with local organizing committee, participants, sponsors and suppliers.

projects.title: Celebration of the Maastricht Treaty 2007
projects.description:
Organized together with the Maastricht - Europe team an celebration to remember the singing of the Maastricht Treaty 15 years earlier. Invited were people involved in 1992 and who put their signatures at the treaty which was the agreement to one European currency.

A special book has been released with anecdotes of many politicians looking back to the actual celebrations.

I was responsible for the invitations, logistics and exhibition of the original treaty, which was brought back from Rome to Maastricht for this occasion.

Received an incentive by mayor Gerd Leers.
